data.title: Great selection of whiskey
data.text: I popped in here with about an hour to kill and was very impressed with the selection of whiskey. I ordered a single malt scotch and it was perfect. They have a very comfortable sitting area.

data.title: Small, Cozy Whiskey and Speciality Cocktail Bar
data.text: Very good selection of whiskey and "gourmet" cocktails.  Also beer and wine.  Appetizer and entrée food offerings on a small intimate surrounding. Prompt and attentive service. Whiskey flights offer a good way to find what you like. On street parking limited at times.

data.title: Great night out with friends
data.text: good food and cocktails best in Beaverton will definitely be back as soon as possible for more food and drinks añd will bring mor friends

data.title: The Whole Package!
data.text: So glad we veered out from our weekend in Portland and found this. To get out of the rain and enter a warm and inviting atmosphere was a comfort. Then, to enjoy the Juniper Mule and Elderflower Old Fashioned drinks along with the Bacon Wrapped Shrimp and Cranberry Walnut Baked Brie totally hit the spot. A happy hour that you can relax at...

data.title: Come for the cocktails not the food.
data.text:
As a bar, this place serves up flavorful and inspired cocktails.  Drinks are stiff, so watch yourselves.  The food was mediocre.  My wife and I had the beef and lamb meatballs.  Both were a little on the chewy side.  Suspect they were reheated in the microwave.  Flavor was underwhelming.  
Will be back again for date night, but we'll eat elsewhere.

data.title: Whisky flights say no more!
data.text:
Friends took me to this small bar in Beaverton, OR. Quiet enough for pleasant conversation - understated ambiance with light fixtures from Mason jars - famous bootleggers pictures on the walls - couches and chairs with coffee tables in the front windows and high tops toward the back. 
The bar food is good. I had bacon wrapped shrimp and meatballs (two different dishes - not one😜) and grinds had pulled pork sliders and chicken skewers. Both are thumbs up. 
But it is a Whisky bar! Had a flight trying three Ryes. whistle pig, WE Taylor and Angel's Envy. The Angels Envy Rye was the fond of the night. Better than the Bourbon of the same name.   Try Bootleggers - you will not be disappointed.

data.title: Excellent Bloody Mary Bar and Breakfast!!
data.text:
We went for their Sunday Brunch.  I loved their Bloody Mary Bar, they serve the vodka in a tall glass, you go to the bar, and add the tabasco, horseradish, celery, olives, cucumbers, pickled asparagus, pickled beans, hot sauce (many choices), etc.  

I ordered the eggs benedict traditional, homemade sauce, eggs poached perfectly, and a thick piece of Canadian bacon on the traditional English Muffin.  It could not be better!!     Friends had the Smoked Salmon Hash, the Baked Casserole Egg, Potato Egg Dish, Bourbon French Toast, and the most wonderful Bourbon Bacon!!!  They also serve a Pancetta eggs benedict, and many more choices.  We shared a seasonal fresh fruit plate.

Everything was just wonderful, and the prices were very good for the quality of everything served!!!

data.title: Great food, lovely atmosphere
data.text:
I've been going here roughly every other week for social outings. It's got a modern industrial design with a speakeasy touch. The small establishment uses warm lighting and lots of woodwork to make the place feel more intimate and casual whether you're out with a date or with a small group of close friends.

Most places skimp on the whiskey in a cocktail. Here the whiskey sour was just the right balance. I also recommend the Elderflower cocktail. You may also be interested in a flight, if you're not to versed in whiskeys or want to try something new.
All they serve is types of whiskeys, so be prepared to spend a buck or 10 (which you will of course enjoy as a sipping drink). 

The dinner specials and entrees are always well prepared and delicious. Even if you're not too keen on whiskey, just going for the food is worth it. Though I haven't tried it, they also serve Sunday brunch.

data.title: Nice place - great theme
data.text: We stopped in during happy hour to check this place out. Very cool theme & decor inside. The bartender was knowledgeable and prepared drinks properly. NIce cocktail menu and selection. A small selection of appetizers/light items for sharing while you have your drink. We would definitely go back again.

data.title: Great Whiskey Bar in Beaverton
data.text: Tried this place out for first time tonight, been meaning to stop in.  It was a windy, rainy, stormy night...perfect night for a couple of whiskies.  The bar was pretty empty based on the time we arrived, but it definitely was filling up as we left.  The bartender and server were great, very friendly.  With solid knowledge of the liquors they were selling and how to mix them.  They even made something new for my wife with a liqueur they'd just received from a local distiller (Indio) and that was great too.  The vibe is definitely prohibition era from the decor to the music.  There are no TVs, because this place is about conversation and cocktails and it's a fantastic place to enjoy a cocktail or a whiskey.  We'll be back.  Prices were excellent as well, especially when compared to the whiskey bars in Portland.

data.title: Great place for a drink and an appetizer in downtown Beaverton
data.text: Bootleggers is adjacent to the Broadway Saloon on Broadway in old downtown Beaverton.  It is just a little divey, but not in an off-putting way.  They have a great selection of liquors and some very nice appetizers.  I would have to say that if you put this place in downtown Portland, it would be crawling with young hipsters, but they don't seem to have much interest in seeking out a place in the burbs.  All the better for those of us who are a little older and not nearly as cool.
